text: A new partnership for schools

text: Involving parents in the education of their children and ensuring schools are supported by local communities are both essential to achieving higher standards and a better use of resources.

text: We will:
title: Make the Difference

text: - Increase the role of parents in education.

text: We will extend home/school/pupil links, develop home-school partnership arrangements and support parents with information and resources to help them help their child.

text: We will require the schools inspection service to report on home-school partnerships as part of school inspections.
title: Make the Difference

text: We will promote school councils and guarantee automatic representation on governing bodies to staff and, where appropriate, students.
title: Make the Difference

text: - Open up schools to the whole community.

text: We will encourage schools to develop courses for parents, build links with local leisure organisations to open up school sports facilities to the community and work with local businesses to provide improved computer education.
title: Make the Difference

text: - Give all schools more independence and allow them to develop their own styles and strengths.

text: We will devolve as many powers as possible to schools and give them more control over their budgets.

text: We will replace the Student Loans Scheme with a fair repayment scheme linked to salaries in later life.

text: We oppose top-up fees for tuition.

text: We will work with the private sector to link all schools to the Information Super Highway and ensure that they have the equipment and skills to take advantage of this.

text: We will charge the Bank with keeping inflation low and make it accountable to Parliament for achieving this goal.

text: Lower inflation and greater exchange rate stability can be better secured by working with Britain's European partners.

text: Our aim: To make year-on-year improvements in the health of Britain's people and the quality of the National Health Service.

text: - Invest £200 million each year to recruit more staff for front-line patient care.

text: Raising standards in the NHS

text: Whilst many of the recent reforms to the NHS have been beneficial, they have resulted in the creation of a two-tier health service.
title: Make the Difference

text: The standard of health care a person receives is increasingly becoming a lottery.

text: We will:
title: Make the Difference

text: - Match NHS facilities to needs.

title: Make the Difference

text: - End the built-in two-tier service in the NHS.

text: The NHS is underfunded.

text: Reforming the United Nations

text: Playing a leading role in strengthening and reforming the United Nations should be a central aspect of Britain's foreign policy over the next decade.

title: Make the Difference

text: No taxation without explanation

text: Central Government should inform taxpayers of the ways in which their money is raised and spent, just as local councils now do.
